column3: Ack. Passes my testnet reorg tests.\n
"Unchecked" sounds scary.  Maybe SetBestChainInner().\nAnd an assert(pindexNew->pprev == pindexBest) would be good.\n
I believe there is a BOOST_REVERSE_FOREACH() that would eliminate the reverse() call.\n

Mostly a note to myself... but I have a feeling we might soon implement 'gentle' block discouragement-- if we get another block/chain with equal work to the one we have now, perhaps orphan the existing one if we like the new one better (maybe: it removes more transactions from the memory pool than the current best, or it is from one of my mining consortium buddies, or has some of my wallet transac
This can probably be abstracted into a common function later. What about an operator< / operator== for CBlockIndex ?\n
